intro: Ononis tridentata subsp. barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three narrow, pointed leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
